result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deanna Marie Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deanna M. Johnson in court with attorney Thomas A Starr.  Defendant Deanna M. Johnson in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites agreement.
DE entered plea of NC to 15 CF 255 count 2, 15 CF 204 count 3 , 15 CF 154 and 17 CF 12 count 1.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.   Court asks Atty Starr if he was satisfied that his client knowingly and freely was entering into this agreement.  Atty Starr states yes.    Court further addressed the DE.
  Court finds defendant guilty count 2 in 15 CF 255, count 3 in 15 CF 204, 15 CF 154 and count 1 in 17 CF 12.

Court:  15 CF 255 count 2:  9 months county jail with credit for 27 days time served good time and huber to begin on/before 5/26/17 at 3:00 pm - DE will obtain day for day credit if successfully completes inpatient treatment - fine/costs $579.00 counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read-in

15 CF 204 count 3:  Sentence w/held probation 4 years - fine/costs $1630.50 - 90 days consecutive to 15 CF 255  county jail credit for 2 days time served  - any counseling DOC may recommend - AODA and follow thru - pshychological assessment - take all medication as prescirbed and as prescribed- cognitive behavioral class - no possession of illegal drugs - not to enter an establsihment that sells alcohol for consumption on the premises- counts 1, 2 and 4 are dismissed and read-in - consecutive to 15 CF 255  / 16 CF 36 - 16 CM 136, 16 CT 216 are dismissed and read-in

15 CF 154:   Sentence w/held probation 4 years - fine/costs $1630.50 - Restitution to LCO of $80.00 - any counseling DOC may recommend - 16 days credit time served if probation is revoked -   concurrent to 15 CF 204  / 16 CF 36 - 16 CM 136, 16 CT 216 are dismissed and read-in


17 CF 12 count 1 :   Sentence w/held probation 4 years - fine/costs $654.00- -  any counseling DOC may recommend - count 2 is dismissed and read-in -  concurrent to 15 CF 204 and 15 CF 154  / 16 CF 36 - 16 CM 136, 16 CT 216 are dismissed and read-in
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 29, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Also has 15 CF 154, 15 CF 204, 15 CF 255, 16 CF 36 and unfiled case.  State requests bond be set at (new file) c/b $500.00.  Court questions defendant.  Court bail set at $250.00  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2017 at 12:45 pm.  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2017 at 12:45 pm.

Defendant Deanna M. Johnson in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CF 154, 16 CM 136, 16 CF 36, 16 CT 216 and 15 CF 255.  Court questions DE as to obtaining a PD.  Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Atty Chapman states DE has requested new attorney, PD will appoint 1 more public defender.    Court Atty Chapman is released as attorney.  Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Deanna M. Johnson in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CF 204, 16 CM 136, 15 CF 255 and 16 CF 36.  Atty Chapman addressed the Court requests adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

DE requests, state does not object and court allows adjournment for DE to meet with doctor for evaluation.  Court amends bond to add this condition.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Judge John Anderson appears in Bayfield County via phone - State appears via phone by Bruce Poquette - Defendant appears by Attorney Daniel Chapman who appears via phone requesting a plea hearing be set.  Plea/sentencing set for 5/27/16 at 3:00 pm. (clerked by Bayfield county KC)
Status conference on April 27, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Deanna Marie Johnson in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Deanna Marie Johnson in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  State requests c/b $2000.00 combined 15 CF 204, 15 cF 154 and 15 CF 255.  Court C/b granted $2000.00 and warrants are quashed.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
